rapidjson
A fast JSON parser/generator for C++ with both SAX/DOM style API

00011 // RAPIDJSON_NO_INT64DEFINE
00012 
00013 // Here defines int64_t and uint64_t types in global namespace.
00014 // If user have their own definition, can define RAPIDJSON_NO_INT64DEFINE to disable this.
00015 #ifndef RAPIDJSON_NO_INT64DEFINE
00016 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00017 typedef __int64 int64_t;
00018 typedef unsigned __int64 uint64_t;
00019 #else
00020 #include <inttypes.h>
00021 #endif
00022 #endif // RAPIDJSON_NO_INT64TYPEDEF

00024 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00025 // RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN
00026 #define RAPIDJSON_LITTLEENDIAN  0       //!< Little endian machine
00027 #define RAPIDJSON_BIGENDIAN             1       //!< Big endian machine
00028 
00029 //! Endianness of the machine.
00030 /*!     GCC provided macro for detecting endianness of the target machine. But other
00031         compilers may not have this. User can define RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN to either
00032         RAPIDJSON_LITTLEENDIAN or RAPIDJSON_BIGENDIAN.
00033 */
00034 #ifndef RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN
00035 #ifdef __BYTE_ORDER__
00036 #if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__
00037 #define RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN RAPIDJSON_LITTLEENDIAN
00038 #else
00039 #define RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN RAPIDJSON_BIGENDIAN
00040 #endif // __BYTE_ORDER__
00041 #else
00042 #define RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN RAPIDJSON_LITTLEENDIAN // Assumes little endian otherwise.
00043 #endif
00044 #endif // RAPIDJSON_ENDIAN

00052 // Enable SSE4.2 optimization.

00055 #if defined(RAPIDJSON_SSE2) || defined(RAPIDJSON_SSE42)
00056 #define RAPIDJSON_SIMD
00057 #endif

00065 /*! User may override the SizeType by defining RAPIDJSON_NO_SIZETYPEDEFINE.
00066 */
00067 typedef unsigned SizeType;

00071 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00072 // RAPIDJSON_ASSERT
00073 
00074 //! Assertion.
00075 /*! By default, rapidjson uses C assert() for assertion.
00076         User can override it by defining RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(x) macro.
00077 */
00078 #ifndef RAPIDJSON_ASSERT
00079 #include <cassert>
00080 #define RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(x) assert(x)
00081 #endif // RAPIDJSON_ASSERT

00083 namespace rapidjson {
00084 
00085 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00086 // Allocator
00087 
00088 /*! \class rapidjson::Allocator
00089         \brief Concept for allocating, resizing and freeing memory block.
00090         
00091         Note that Malloc() and Realloc() are non-static but Free() is static.
00092         
00093         So if an allocator need to support Free(), it needs to put its pointer in 
00094         the header of memory block.
00095 
00096 \code
00097 concept Allocator {
00098         static const bool kNeedFree;    //!< Whether this allocator needs to call Free().
00099 
00100         // Allocate a memory block.
00101         // \param size of the memory block in bytes.
00102         // \returns pointer to the memory block.
00103         void* Malloc(size_t size);
00104 
00105         // Resize a memory block.
00106         // \param originalPtr The pointer to current memory block. Null pointer is permitted.
00107         // \param originalSize The current size in bytes. (Design issue: since some allocator may not book-keep this, explicitly pass to it can save memory.)
00108         // \param newSize the new size in bytes.
00109         void* Realloc(void* originalPtr, size_t originalSize, size_t newSize);
00110 
00111         // Free a memory block.
00112         // \param pointer to the memory block. Null pointer is permitted.
00113         static void Free(void *ptr);
00114 };
00115 \endcode
00116 */
00117 
00118 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00119 // CrtAllocator
00120 
00121 //! C-runtime library allocator.
00122 /*! This class is just wrapper for standard C library memory routines.
00123         \implements Allocator
00124 */
00125 class CrtAllocator {
00126 public:
00127         static const bool kNeedFree = true;
00128         void* Malloc(size_t size) { return malloc(size); }
00129         void* Realloc(void* originalPtr, size_t originalSize, size_t newSize) { return realloc(originalPtr, newSize); }
00130         static void Free(void *ptr) { free(ptr); }
00131 };
00132 
00133 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00134 // MemoryPoolAllocator
00135 
00136 //! Default memory allocator used by the parser and DOM.
00137 /*! This allocator allocate memory blocks from pre-allocated memory chunks. 
00138 
00139     It does not free memory blocks. And Realloc() only allocate new memory.
00140 
00141     The memory chunks are allocated by BaseAllocator, which is CrtAllocator by default.
00142 
00143     User may also supply a buffer as the first chunk.
00144 
00145     If the user-buffer is full then additional chunks are allocated by BaseAllocator.
00146 
00147     The user-buffer is not deallocated by this allocator.
00148 
00149     \tparam BaseAllocator the allocator type for allocating memory chunks. Default is CrtAllocator.
00150         \implements Allocator
00151 */
00152 template <typename BaseAllocator = CrtAllocator>
00153 class MemoryPoolAllocator {
00154 public:
00155         static const bool kNeedFree = false;    //!< Tell users that no need to call Free() with this allocator. (concept Allocator)
00156 
00157         //! Constructor with chunkSize.
00158         /*! \param chunkSize The size of memory chunk. The default is kDefaultChunkSize.
00159                 \param baseAllocator The allocator for allocating memory chunks.
00160         */
00161         MemoryPoolAllocator(size_t chunkSize = kDefaultChunkCapacity, BaseAllocator* baseAllocator = 0) : 
00162                 chunkHead_(0), chunk_capacity_(chunkSize), userBuffer_(0), baseAllocator_(baseAllocator), ownBaseAllocator_(0)
00163         {
00164                 if (!baseAllocator_)
00165                         ownBaseAllocator_ = baseAllocator_ = new BaseAllocator();
00166                 AddChunk(chunk_capacity_);
00167         }
00168 
00169         //! Constructor with user-supplied buffer.
00170         /*! The user buffer will be used firstly. When it is full, memory pool allocates new chunk with chunk size.
00171 
00172                 The user buffer will not be deallocated when this allocator is destructed.
00173 
00174                 \param buffer User supplied buffer.
00175                 \param size Size of the buffer in bytes. It must at least larger than sizeof(ChunkHeader).
00176                 \param chunkSize The size of memory chunk. The default is kDefaultChunkSize.
00177                 \param baseAllocator The allocator for allocating memory chunks.
00178         */
00179         MemoryPoolAllocator(char *buffer, size_t size, size_t chunkSize = kDefaultChunkCapacity, BaseAllocator* baseAllocator = 0) :
00180                 chunkHead_(0), chunk_capacity_(chunkSize), userBuffer_(buffer), baseAllocator_(baseAllocator), ownBaseAllocator_(0)
00181         {
00182                 RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(buffer != 0);
00183                 RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(size > sizeof(ChunkHeader));
00184                 chunkHead_ = (ChunkHeader*)buffer;
00185                 chunkHead_->capacity = size - sizeof(ChunkHeader);
00186                 chunkHead_->size = 0;
00187                 chunkHead_->next = 0;
00188         }
00189 
00190         //! Destructor.
00191         /*! This deallocates all memory chunks, excluding the user-supplied buffer.
00192         */
00193         ~MemoryPoolAllocator() {
00194                 Clear();
00195                 delete ownBaseAllocator_;
00196         }
00197 
00198         //! Deallocates all memory chunks, excluding the user-supplied buffer.
00199         void Clear() {
00200                 while(chunkHead_ != 0 && chunkHead_ != (ChunkHeader *)userBuffer_) {
00201                         ChunkHeader* next = chunkHead_->next;
00202                         baseAllocator_->Free(chunkHead_);
00203                         chunkHead_ = next;
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 
00207         //! Computes the total capacity of allocated memory chunks.
00208         /*! \return total capacity in bytes.
00209         */
00210         size_t Capacity() {
00211                 size_t capacity = 0;
00212                 for (ChunkHeader* c = chunkHead_; c != 0; c = c->next)
00213                         capacity += c->capacity;
00214                 return capacity;
00215         }
00216 
00217         //! Computes the memory blocks allocated.
00218         /*! \return total used bytes.
00219         */
00220         size_t Size() {
00221                 size_t size = 0;
00222                 for (ChunkHeader* c = chunkHead_; c != 0; c = c->next)
00223                         size += c->size;
00224                 return size;
00225         }
00226 
00227         //! Allocates a memory block. (concept Allocator)
00228         void* Malloc(size_t size) {
00229                 if (chunkHead_->size + size > chunkHead_->capacity)
00230                         AddChunk(chunk_capacity_ > size ? chunk_capacity_ : size);
00231 
00232                 char *buffer = (char *)(chunkHead_ + 1) + chunkHead_->size;
00233                 chunkHead_->size += size;
00234                 return buffer;
00235         }
00236 
00237         //! Resizes a memory block (concept Allocator)
00238         void* Realloc(void* originalPtr, size_t originalSize, size_t newSize) {
00239                 if (originalPtr == 0)
00240                         return Malloc(newSize);
00241 
00242                 // Do not shrink if new size is smaller than original
00243                 if (originalSize >= newSize)
00244                         return originalPtr;
00245 
00246                 // Simply expand it if it is the last allocation and there is sufficient space
00247                 if (originalPtr == (char *)(chunkHead_ + 1) + chunkHead_->size - originalSize) {
00248                         size_t increment = newSize - originalSize;
00249                         if (chunkHead_->size + increment <= chunkHead_->capacity) {
00250                                 chunkHead_->size += increment;
00251                                 return originalPtr;
00252                         }
00253                 }
00254 
00255                 // Realloc process: allocate and copy memory, do not free original buffer.
00256                 void* newBuffer = Malloc(newSize);
00257                 RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(newBuffer != 0);       // Do not handle out-of-memory explicitly.
00258                 return memcpy(newBuffer, originalPtr, originalSize);
00259         }
00260 
00261         //! Frees a memory block (concept Allocator)
00262         static void Free(void *ptr) {} // Do nothing
00263 
00264 private:
00265         //! Creates a new chunk.
00266         /*! \param capacity Capacity of the chunk in bytes.
00267         */
00268         void AddChunk(size_t capacity) {
00269                 ChunkHeader* chunk = (ChunkHeader*)baseAllocator_->Malloc(sizeof(ChunkHeader) + capacity);
00270                 chunk->capacity = capacity;
00271                 chunk->size = 0;
00272                 chunk->next = chunkHead_;
00273                 chunkHead_ =  chunk;
00274         }
00275 
00276         static const int kDefaultChunkCapacity = 64 * 1024; //!< Default chunk capacity.
00277 
00278         //! Chunk header for perpending to each chunk.
00279         /*! Chunks are stored as a singly linked list.
00280         */
00281         struct ChunkHeader {
00282                 size_t capacity;        //!< Capacity of the chunk in bytes (excluding the header itself).
00283                 size_t size;            //!< Current size of allocated memory in bytes.
00284                 ChunkHeader *next;      //!< Next chunk in the linked list.
00285         };
00286 
00287         ChunkHeader *chunkHead_;        //!< Head of the chunk linked-list. Only the head chunk serves allocation.
00288         size_t chunk_capacity_;         //!< The minimum capacity of chunk when they are allocated.
00289         char *userBuffer_;                      //!< User supplied buffer.
00290         BaseAllocator* baseAllocator_;  //!< base allocator for allocating memory chunks.
00291         BaseAllocator* ownBaseAllocator_;       //!< base allocator created by this object.
00292 };
00293 
00294 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00295 // Encoding
00296 
00297 /*! \class rapidjson::Encoding
00298         \brief Concept for encoding of Unicode characters.
00299 
00300 \code
00301 concept Encoding {
00302         typename Ch;    //! Type of character.
00303 
00304         //! \brief Encode a Unicode codepoint to a buffer.
00305         //! \param buffer pointer to destination buffer to store the result. It should have sufficient size of encoding one character.
00306         //! \param codepoint An unicode codepoint, ranging from 0x0 to 0x10FFFF inclusively.
00307         //! \returns the pointer to the next character after the encoded data.
00308         static Ch* Encode(Ch *buffer, unsigned codepoint);
00309 };
00310 \endcode
00311 */
00312 
00313 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00314 // UTF8
00315 
00316 //! UTF-8 encoding.
00317 /*! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8
00318         \tparam CharType Type for storing 8-bit UTF-8 data. Default is char.
00319         \implements Encoding
00320 */
00321 template<typename CharType = char>
00322 struct UTF8 {
00323         typedef CharType Ch;
00324 
00325         static Ch* Encode(Ch *buffer, unsigned codepoint) {
00326                 if (codepoint <= 0x7F) 
00327                         *buffer++ = codepoint & 0xFF;
00328                 else if (codepoint <= 0x7FF) {
00329                         *buffer++ = 0xC0 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0xFF);
00330                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | ((codepoint & 0x3F));
00331                 }
00332                 else if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF) {
00333                         *buffer++ = 0xE0 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0xFF);
00334                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F);
00335                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F);
00336                 }
00337                 else {
00338                         RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
00339                         *buffer++ = 0xF0 | ((codepoint >> 18) & 0xFF);
00340                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F);
00341                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F);
00342                         *buffer++ = 0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F);
00343                 }
00344                 return buffer;
00345         }
00346 };
00347 
00348 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00349 // UTF16
00350 
00351 //! UTF-16 encoding.
00352 /*! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-16
00353         \tparam CharType Type for storing 16-bit UTF-16 data. Default is wchar_t. C++11 may use char16_t instead.
00354         \implements Encoding
00355 */
00356 template<typename CharType = wchar_t>
00357 struct UTF16 {
00358         typedef CharType Ch;
00359 
00360         static Ch* Encode(Ch* buffer, unsigned codepoint) {
00361                 if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF) {
00362                         RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(codepoint < 0xD800 || codepoint > 0xDFFF); // Code point itself cannot be surrogate pair 
00363                         *buffer++ = codepoint;
00364                 }
00365                 else {
00366                         RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
00367                         unsigned v = codepoint - 0x10000;
00368                         *buffer++ = (v >> 10) + 0xD800;
00369                         *buffer++ = (v & 0x3FF) + 0xDC00;
00370                 }
00371                 return buffer;
00372         }
00373 };
00374 
00375 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00376 // UTF32
00377 
00378 //! UTF-32 encoding. 
00379 /*! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-32
00380         \tparam Ch Type for storing 32-bit UTF-32 data. Default is unsigned. C++11 may use char32_t instead.
00381         \implements Encoding
00382 */
00383 template<typename CharType = unsigned>
00384 struct UTF32 {
00385         typedef CharType Ch;
00386 
00387         static Ch *Encode(Ch* buffer, unsigned codepoint) {
00388                 RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
00389                 *buffer++ = codepoint;
00390                 return buffer;
00391         }
00392 };
00393 
00394 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00395 //  Stream
00396 
00397 /*! \class rapidjson::Stream
00398         \brief Concept for reading and writing characters.
00399 
00400         For read-only stream, no need to implement PutBegin(), Put() and PutEnd().
00401 
00402         For write-only stream, only need to implement Put().
00403 
00404 \code
00405 concept Stream {
00406         typename Ch;    //!< Character type of the stream.
00407 
00408         //! Read the current character from stream without moving the read cursor.
00409         Ch Peek() const;
00410 
00411         //! Read the current character from stream and moving the read cursor to next character.
00412         Ch Take();
00413 
00414         //! Get the current read cursor.
00415         //! \return Number of characters read from start.
00416         size_t Tell();
00417 
00418         //! Begin writing operation at the current read pointer.
00419         //! \return The begin writer pointer.
00420         Ch* PutBegin();
00421 
00422         //! Write a character.
00423         void Put(Ch c);
00424 
00425         //! End the writing operation.
00426         //! \param begin The begin write pointer returned by PutBegin().
00427         //! \return Number of characters written.
00428         size_t PutEnd(Ch* begin);
00429 }
00430 \endcode
00431 */
00432 
00433 //! Put N copies of a character to a stream.
00434 template<typename Stream, typename Ch>
00435 inline void PutN(Stream& stream, Ch c, size_t n) {
00436         for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++)
00437                 stream.Put(c);
00438 }
00439 
00440 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00441 // StringStream
00442 
00443 //! Read-only string stream.
00444 /*! \implements Stream
00445 */
00446 template <typename Encoding>
00447 struct GenericStringStream {
00448         typedef typename Encoding::Ch Ch;
00449 
00450         GenericStringStream(const Ch *src) : src_(src), head_(src) {}
00451 
00452         Ch Peek() const { return *src_; }
00453         Ch Take() { return *src_++; }
00454         size_t Tell() const { return src_ - head_; }
00455 
00456         Ch* PutBegin() { RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(false); return 0; }
00457         void Put(Ch c) { RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(false); }
00458         size_t PutEnd(Ch* begin) { RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(false); return 0; }
00459 
00460         const Ch* src_;         //!< Current read position.
00461         const Ch* head_;        //!< Original head of the string.
00462 };
00463 
00464 typedef GenericStringStream<UTF8<> > StringStream;
00465 
00466 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00467 // InsituStringStream
00468 
00469 //! A read-write string stream.
00470 /*! This string stream is particularly designed for in-situ parsing.
00471         \implements Stream
00472 */
00473 template <typename Encoding>
00474 struct GenericInsituStringStream {
00475         typedef typename Encoding::Ch Ch;
00476 
00477         GenericInsituStringStream(Ch *src) : src_(src), dst_(0), head_(src) {}
00478 
00479         // Read
00480         Ch Peek() { return *src_; }
00481         Ch Take() { return *src_++; }
00482         size_t Tell() { return src_ - head_; }
00483 
00484         // Write
00485         Ch* PutBegin() { return dst_ = src_; }
00486         void Put(Ch c) { RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(dst_ != 0); *dst_++ = c; }
00487         size_t PutEnd(Ch* begin) { return dst_ - begin; }
00488 
00489         Ch* src_;
00490         Ch* dst_;
00491         Ch* head_;
00492 };
00493 
00494 typedef GenericInsituStringStream<UTF8<> > InsituStringStream;
00495 
00496 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00497 // Type
00498 
00499 //! Type of JSON value
00500 enum Type {
00501         kNullType = 0,          //!< null
00502         kFalseType = 1,         //!< false
00503         kTrueType = 2,          //!< true
00504         kObjectType = 3,        //!< object
00505         kArrayType = 4,         //!< array 
00506         kStringType = 5,        //!< string
00507         kNumberType = 6,        //!< number
00508 };
